reference.title: Migrating to release 2.1
reference.shortdesc: In DITA-OT 2.1, the insertVariable template was deprecated for PDF transformations and should be replaced with the getVariable template. Various dita.out.map.* targets have been deprecated in favor of updated dita.map.* equivalents.

section.note: This topic provides a summary of changes in DITA-OT 2.1 that may require modifications to custom stylesheets or plug-ins. For more information on changes in this release, see the .

section.p: The customFileUtils code used to handle input and output in earlier versions of DITA-OT has been replaced with the Apache Commons IO utilities library.

section.p: A newdita.parser extension point has been added to allow plug-ins to contribute a custom parser for DITA files. If a custom DITA parser is defined, the preprocessing routines will use it during the gen-list and debug-filter stages to output DITA XML.

section.title: XHTML
section.p: The dita.out.map.xhtml.toc target has been deprecated and should be replaced with the updated dita.map.xhtml.toc equivalent.

Keydef processing has been removed from the XHTML rendering code. Keys are now resolved in one preprocessing step, whereas in earlier versions of DITA-OT, the XHTML code returned to the keydef.xml file to look up targets for phrase elements and pull in text when needed.
This change affects non-linking elements that canâ€™t take href attributes, such as ph, keyword, cite, dt, term, and indexterm (when $INDEXSHOW is active).

section.title: OpenDocument Text
section.p: Support for the args.odt.img.embed parameter has been removed from OpenDocument Text transformations. The previous default behavior was to embed images as Base64-encoded text, but editors do not use this as a default. Instead, office packages such as LibreOffice will convert embedded images into linked images on opening and saving an ODT file.
